discourse_list.title: Incubating Legal & Transactional Services (LTS): Weekly Update

content.content: To provide the Maker community with enhanced transparency on the transaction-related activities I am undertaking in support of Maker DAO and the Real World Finance program, I will be providing a brief weekly update. I have excluded from this update regularly scheduled interactions (e.g., off-chain collateral management meeting, weekly meeting with SES on core unit incubation,etc.).  Week of May 2nd  Develop draft detailed transaction execution schedule for HVBank HVBank alignment meeting on transaction execution schedule, transaction agreements, and agreement preparation Meeting with CES to discuss MIP21 and token mechanics for HVBank Draft detailed terms and conditions for transaction agreements for scheduled discussion with HVBank in mid May    SG Forge weekly meeting Review revised DAI Loan Agreement and Instruction Letter, draft revisions based on weekly meeting alignment, circulate to SG Forge. Most revisions finalizing and fine-tuning the mechanics.    Review Maple D3M transaction agreements and provide written comments Conference with Maple on comments to transaction agreements    Align with Centrifuge on final wording for Centrifuge draft Indenture Trust Agreement    RWF Office Hours Presentation on Taxonomy for Decision-Making for Real World Assets  Also, other than the SG Forge transaction, North Lakes Legal has not yet instructed external counsel to support the above. I do anticipate external support for the HVBank transaction and I am finalizing the engagement letter. Happy to respond to any questions. @Real-World-Finance @luca_pro
Thanks for the update! Sounds like things are moving right along!

Weekly Update Week of May 9th A quieter week as I had taken off on Monday and Tuesday. In addition to the regular Maker DAO coordinating activities, please see below.  Attend to term sheet questions from RWACo and HVB    To review revised SG Forge DAI Loan Agreement, Instruction Letter and Runbook SG Forge’s French counsel is preparing the draft French pledge agreement Review CES draft technical assessment    Commence New Silver legal review    Follow-up conference with Maple on D3M transaction agreements and comments

Week of May 16th The work undertaken by the incubating LTS for the week of May 16th. This excludes the regular Maker DAO coordinating activities.  SG Forge   Reviewing and preparing additions to the Commercial/Legal Risk Assessment   Reviewing and preparing comments to the Technical Risk Assessment   GIDE, SG Forge’s French counsel, is preparing a draft French Pledge Agreement    HVB   @eumenes and @christiancdpetersen in person meeting with HVB deal team and RWACo to review term sheet, align on commercial and legal terms, overall participation mechanics, and timeline. HVB to prepare a revised term sheet to reflect meeting outcomes. A fully aligned term sheet will provide the basis for the commercial/legal risk assessment.   Prepare draft Trust Agreement with governance enhancements   Prepare draft revisions to organizational documents for RWA Foundation in order to implement the HVB transaction   Review and discuss CES MIP21 technical assessment   Engagement letter with external US legal firm signed   Renengage Cayman counsel to support on RWA Foundation legal work    Maple Finance  Review Maple Finance responses to legal diligence questions   ADT Combustors / OPM Kick-off deal execution process As always, I would be pleased to answer any questions, concerns, etc either here, via DM or in the RWF CU office hours.

Week of May 23 Most of the focus for the past week continues to be on the HVB transaction, with alignment on the Term Sheet and preparation of the governance documents (the Trust Agreement and RWA Foundation revised organizational documents) the focus. @teej will provide his weekly update on HVB to supplement the below. HVB   Review, revise and finalize Term Sheet   Prepare initial draft Trust Agreement   Prepare draft revisions to organizational documents for RWA Foundation to implement the HVB transaction   Prepare updates to HVB Risk Assessment   Assist on KYC/AML procedures for RWA Foundation    SG Forge   SG Forge reviewing the Commercial/Legal risk assessment   Real World Finance Core Unit and LTS to finalize and publish Commercial/Legal risk assessment after SG Forge review    ADT Combustors / OPM  Kick-off call on deal execution process and discussion of deal economics   Maple  Re-read Master Loan Agreement and Pool Delegate and assess legal and commercial issues   TrueFi  Attend introductory kick-off call   I continue to make “two steps forward, one step back” progress to on-board external law firms to support on various transactions. Most firms struggle with their diligence of the relationship between myself, the Real World Finance Core Unit and MakerDAO. It is an educational process as we do not fit nicely into their rubric. Other than SG Forge, I have not yet officially instructed any of the firms to begin work. However, as we move into the documentation phase of transactions, we will require that additional support.

christiancdpetersen:  I continue to make “two steps forward, one step back” progress to on-board external law firms to support on various transactions. Most firms struggle with their diligence of the relationship between myself, the Real World Finance Core Unit and MakerDAO. It is an educational process as we do not fit nicely into their rubric.   I understand completely. I have assumed this would be the case and there would be a learning curve for firms (not limited to RWF). I figured some firms would struggle with these issues because they need to ethically navigate who is the client, what is confidential, what is privileged etc. If they don’t adapt they will be behind so hopefully they make it work.

Week of May 30th As the Maker community will see from the matters below, the volume of work being handled by LTS is ramping up. The focus continues to be on HVB and SocGen in the immediate short-term as these transactions are furtherest along. The D3M diligence is also kicking into higher gear. LTS is also facilitating the Monetalis MIP65. LTS continues to actively interact and collaborate with @Real-World-Finance, @collateral-core-unit and @Growth-Core-Unit on the matters below. HVB   Prepare draft revisions to organizational documents for RWA Foundation to implement the HVB transaction   Prepare updates to HVB Risk Assessment   Assist on KYC/AML procedures for RWA Foundation for potential USD/DAI broker and the calculation agent supporting the Trust   Assist on RWA Master Participation Trust formation documentation   Discuss Delegated Committee with potential delegates   SG Forge   Finalize SG Forge risk assessment   Discuss Delegated Committee with potential delegates   Maple   Review legal and proposed collateral structure   Support CES/RWF review of Maple structure   TrueFi  Introductory review of TrueFi structure and investigate D3M structure and KYC  Monetalis (MIP65)  Coordinate with @allan_pedersen on scheduling and next steps  OPM/ADT Combustors   Further work pending pricing alignment   Assist finalization of external counsel engagement letter

christiancdpetersen:   Renengage Cayman counsel to support on RWA Foundation legal work    I was under the impression the EU’s AML blacklisting of Cayman was history–seems it’s still active? Cayman added to the EU’s AML blacklist – what are the consequences?

@flipflopflapdelegate - I am not sure about the EU’s AML blacklisting. But, for purposes of the HVB transaction and the proposed use of RWA Foundation (a Cayman legal entity) as the digital/real world interface, NLL needs to engage Cayman counsel to support some discrete Cayman legal work.

Hello Christian—quick question? How does a Bankruptcy Remote SPV work with the Indenture Trust Agreement you’re currently working on implementing? In other words, does it play well in the sandbox of the Indenture Trust Agreement. As always—thanks in advance!

christiancdpetersen:  This excludes the regular Maker DAO coordinating activities.   You are a machine, but this is unsustainable volume. Please do include everything and the time you also spend on internal DAO coordination meetings, as well as time responding to questions and comments on the Forum (if not already included). Hope our mutual efforts to recruit more legal eyes into the community will bear fruit quickly. It’s not the solution for everything we need officially, but just knowing we have more support even informally would be epic. Perspectives like @MFeinberg for example. We need a casual contributor funnel to grow talent into formal roles from the inside. On it!

I am happy to help out wherever I can, subject to the time constraints imposed upon me by my current role at my firm. I am beholden to my billables for now  I have been in touch with @SES-Core-Unit and voiced some ideas as to other areas as well. When perusing the news I try to make a note of anything I find that is relevant to Maker and the law.

Week of June 6th HVB   Prepare and align on required KYC materials for RWA Foundation and RWA Master Participation Trust with the proposed trustee, calculation agent and exchange broker   Prepare revisions to HVB Risk Assessment and share with HVB for review   Prepare draft Escrow Agreement for RWA Foundation receipt of USD from Genesis Trading (funds flowing in to Trust) and Trust (funds flowing back to Maker). Substantially based on 6S Capital form.   Assist on RWA Master Participation Trust formation documentation   SG Forge   Finalize and publish SG Forge risk assessment   Real World Finance office hours discussion on SG Forge transaction   Maple   Review legal and proposed collateral structure   Support CES/RWF review of Maple structure   TrueFi  Introductory review of TrueFi structure and investigate D3M structure and KYC  New Silver  Align on next steps with New Silver  Monetalis (MIP65)  Alignment meeting with @allan_pedersen on scheduling, next steps and incubating LTS support  OPM/ADT Combustors   Further work pending pricing alignment   Legal kick-off meeting with OPM and OPM’s external counsel   MIP6 Applications  To provide high-level legal overview and comment on Kredika and Cabot MIP6 applications  For completeness, as requested by @ACREinvest, in addition to the deal related work, I actively contribute to the weekly Real World Finance team meeting, a bi-weekly CES<>RWF coordination meeting and the weekly Offchain Collateral Management meeting. Finally, I support RWF in ad hoc interactions with potential MIP6 applicants on various legal and structuring questions and respond to queries in the Forum. As gently prompted by @ACREinvest and others, I will spend more time over the next few weeks preparing the necessary materials for submission of the proposed LTS core unit. Most importantly, this will entail expanding the legal and transactional support for RWF (part-time/full-time (TBD)). I have been selfishly focused on deal execution (I am a self-confessed deal-junkie after all) and I need allocate more time ensuring continuity and support.

christiancdpetersen:  I will spend more time over the next few weeks preparing the necessary materials for submission of the proposed LTS core unit.   Awesome, but I was calling out myself and all of us to be a part of the solution here. We need legal expertise (even if not direct legal counsel) embedded across the DAO in all dimensions - CU, Delegates, anon lurkers… etc.     Embedding legal analysis on new governance proposals Miscellaneous       I’m thinking more in line of cultivating attorneys as full blown members of the community. I don’t think we can get very far with people opining who are not in the mud with us daily/weekly and do not have the same bone-level understanding of what we are trying to achieve.  You are a very unique bird - most lawyers are so engulfed they are far too detached from this space to give good advice at all.  Every outside law firm and lawyer I have hired in my crypto business, I had to spend double time …

ACREinvest:  We need legal expertise (even if not direct legal counsel) embedded across the DAO in all dimensions - CU, Delegates, anon lurkers… etc.   You are going to scare people with all the lawyers lurking lol There are those legal DAOs with lots of attorneys looking to get involved in this space but I think ideally onboarding needs to be organic.
@all lawyers on this thread: what are the types of lawyers/experience needed for potential additions?  I can ask my structured finance lawyer friends if they have any potential leads…

IMO, any practice area, any level of experience. To start, just adding engaged community members (Forum followers and Discord) with the basic training of law schools around the world would be super valuable. People already investing in crypto, using DeFi or exploring “Web3” preferred! Organic… this creates a warm bench we can internally recruit from for specialized roles, deals, initiatives, proposals that need review. Not speaking for @christiancdpetersen on what makes sense for the unique needs of our LTS CU.

Ideally you want attorneys familiar with: securities, governance, public policy and legislation, litigation and alternative dispute resolution, commercial transactions, tax (maybe bankruptcy), data security, M&A, banking, loans and more !

Let us start building this legal contributor funnel by listing all legal minds associated with Maker, classified by area of specialization and jurisdiction. This would be a great resource or the community. We can grow organically like @MFeinberg suggests and then approach legal DAOs like LexDAO or LexPunk

Core Units and contributors often need operational support on things like drafting commercial agreements or terms and conditions, structuring entities or reporting taxes. We need support in 30+ jurisdictions.
Let’s start a new thread where all attorneys can list their info if they wish.
Here is a start ! Calling All Lawyers! Would You Like To Help Contribute?

Week of June 13th HVB   Prepare, collate and submit nearly all KYC documentation for RWA Foundation as required by WSFS, Ankura Trust (calculation agent) and Genesis Trading. Once RWA Master Participation Trust is formed, we will need to complete KYC for RWA Master Participation Trust (as required by Ankura Trust). Address on-going miscellaneous KYC requests.   Review and finalize comments to HVB risk assessment   Coordinate with CES on the functioning of the Maker contracts   Coordinate with WSFS external counsel on the draft Escrow Agreement and the draft Trust Agreement   Focus on document review and preparation, including draft Master Participation Agreement   SG Forge  Weekly SG Forge call and discussion on finalizing the next steps to implementation  Monetalis/Clydesdale  Discussion with CES on Monetalis implementation
Keep grinding!

Week of June 27th My apologies for missing last week’s update and being two days late this week. HVB  I have been nearly 100% focused on processing each of the agreements for the HVB transaction. A brief status is below:      RWA Foundation Articles of Association Drafting amendments to enshrine Maker governance in key decisions (as described in the Risk Assessment).     Escrow Agreement between RWA Foundation and WSFS Aligned with WSFS (ready for execution)   RWA Master Participation Trust Received mark-up from WSFS counsel on 6/29, discussed mark-up with WSFS counsel on 6/30 and LTS will circulate a revised draft on 7/1. No commercial issues identified, mostly mechanical revisions to “automate” certain key Trustee activities - for instance, running the cash waterfall - without requiring direction from the Trust Sponsor.   RWA Participation Agreement Draft received from HVB on 6/24 and LTS provided comments on 6/27. No commercial issues identified. Again, mostly mechanical revisions.   HVB Servicing Agreement Draft received from HVB on 6/24 and LTS provided comments on 6/27. No commercial issues identified.   Ankura Trust Engagement Letter (as Calculation Agent, Crypto Servicer and Custodian) Draft received from Ankura on 6/22 and LTS provided comments on 6/30. The engagement letter required significant updates to include a detailed scope of work for Ankura as Calculation Agent, Crypto Servicer and Custodian    As noted in the updated CES Risk Assessment Here, LTS has, with RWF and CES, been actively exploring options to address counterparty risk in DAI/USD conversion. While the proposed technical solution reduces the counterparty risk, the only technique to eliminate the counterparty risk will be to have RWA Foundation deposit 25M DAI with an escrow agent and have the counterparty deposit $25M with the same escrow agent. The escrow agent would then release funds to the parties. However this solution presents two issues: (1) what escrow agent can accept both DAI and US$?; and (2) is the balance sheet of the escrow agent adequate (or better than the counterparty)? The solution simply shifts the risk from the counterparty to the escrow agent. The proposed solution to limit the size of the draws is, at present, the only viable solution to mitigate the risk. Smaller sized draws will further diminish the risk but require a greater number of executive spells. Incubating LTS has discussed the available options with a New York derivatives lawyer. SocGen   Review and provided comments to SocGen on draft Pledge Agreement   Finalize minor updates to the draft Instruction Letter   Weekly call with SocGen
The wheels are moving along! Onward and upward!
Amazing. Thank you so much @christiancdpetersen VAMOS!

christiancdpetersen:  However this solution presents two issues: (1) what escrow agent can accept both DAI and US$?   I guess this is the moment when community members need to understand that 1 DAI needs to equal $1 US Dollar. Because if it’s off-the-peg, no escrow agent will ever take MakerDAO seriously. Similar to how everyday day Jane and Joe currently think crypto was just a short-lived, “fad.” Sorry, just some off-the-cuff commentary here
Great to see everything coming along!
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
